lines.text: I'll be back in a couple of days.
I feel sorry for you. You're gunna have the parole agents on your tail thicker than flies.
They can camp in my pockets if they want.
Parolees are supposed to be impervious to insults.
I'd rather see you with a hole in your head than in the pen.
They always put your picture in the paper when they grab ya, but they never do when they spring ya.
I hope you get just what you want all tied up in a pink ribbon and handed to you on a platter. So long, honey.
It's no use. I ain't got a chance. Anyway, I ain't got no love for that hot seat.
What's the matter
Nothing.
Oh, you're just crying to make sure you haven't forgotten how.

[to the new cons]
The longer the term, the more good time they gotta give yuh.

[to Chuck and Clint as they are leaving]
Have a good time, boys, but don't stay away too long.
So long, Peter.
You'll be back. You'll be back.

[Bitterly to Clint]
I'm gonna make them pay for every day I spent in that crummt stir!
How do you keep your hair like that, honey?
I'm a rare animal, Chuck. I'm a natural blonde. That's why you went for me quick, wasn't it?
Oh, that and other things.
What's the matter with you, Chuck? I don't fool with no other guy's dames.

[Sarcastically]
I can believe that.

[to Tim]
I much rather see you with a hole in your head than serving time in the pen.

[to Cliff]
Come on up and meet the boys.
Now, if you'd only find a girl and get yourself married, I'd be the happiest woman in the whole world.
What do I want with another girl, Ma. I've got you, haven't I?

[to Cliff]
This is one time we'll fool Old Peter. We won't be back,

[to Lefty]
You better hope I don't find out you was the fink that ratted on me.
